intro: Amberboa crupina, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained sandy soils. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Amberboa crupina is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
